Talking about marketing and computing
Advertis­ing
Memorise the word(s) and listen to the example.
Listen to the dialogue and fill in the gaps.
Our [k]target market[/k] is people between the ages of 18 and 30.
Right. What is our [k]advertising campaign[/k] going to consist of?
Well, we are going to advertise on social networking sites, as well as [k]sponsor[/k] amateur sporting events.
Terrific idea! Sponsorship might not be the cheapest option but people that already do sport are going to be much more likely to want to use our facilties.
That's right. Now we just have to think of a good [k]slogan[/k].
Well, I've actually carried out a small [k]survey[/k] and I think I've found the perfect one!
Excellent! What is it?
Well, let me show you the results of the survey first! Hopefully it will make people want to get fit!
Paul
Margaret
Select the correct option.
Select the words in the correct order.
Fill in the gaps with the correct letters.
How would you advertise a company?
The best way to advertise any company is to consider the target market carefully. Sending out an advertising campaign on television could be very effective.
Surfing the Internet
Last week you learned about the basic functions of your laptop. Today, you're going to learn how to use the university [k]search engine[/k] for research purposes.
Sounds good. Should I [k]turn on[/k] my [k]laptop[/k] now?
Yes, turn it on, open your email and click on the [k]link[/k] that I've emailed to you.
Which of my addresses have you sent it to?
To your personal [k]email[/k] address.
Right. So I just [k]click[/k] on the link and it will open automatically?
Yes, that's right. Then type in the [k]username[/k] and [k]password[/k] I gave you yesterday and you have access to the university research pages.
This looks great! There are so many interesting articles here to use as part of my research.
Paula
Mark
Grammar: Relative clauses II
The sentence contains a relative clause.
My sister, who lives in Paris, is a doctor.
True or false?
This is a picture of my favourite cafe.
My sister who lives in Paris is a doctor.
Defining relative clauses define who or what we are talking about:
My sister who lives in Paris is a doctor. (I have more than one sister, the sister in Paris is a doctor.)
Non-defining relative clauses give extra or additional information:
My sister, who lives in Paris, is a doctor. (I have one sister. She lives in Paris. She is a doctor.)
The sentence contain a non-defining relative clause.
The building, which was renovated last year, is very famous.
I really want to find a relationship which makes me happy.
Emotions, which can be positive or negative, have a huge effect on motivation.
A non-defining relative clause gives information about a noun. They can be taken out and the sentence still has meaning:
The building (, which was renovated last year,) is very famous.
[k]The minister,[/k] [k]who[/k] [k]had been going through a difficult time,[/k][k]was told[/k] [k]to take a holiday.[/k]
[k]The family,[/k] [k]whose[/k] [k]house had been damaged in the storm,[/k] [k]had to[/k] [k]stay in a hotel.[/k]
[k]The painting,[/k] [k]which[/k] [k]was found in the attic last year,[/k] [k]has become[/k] [k]a family favourite.[/k]
In non-defining relative clauses we use the following relative pronouns: who - for people which - for things whose - for possessions 'that' is only used in defining relative clauses
[k]The decision[/k] [k],[/k] [k]which[/k] [k]was made late last night[/k] [k],[/k] [k]will affect[/k] [k]the whole company.[/k]
[k]Paul Richardson[/k] [k],[/k] [k]who[/k] [k]is known and loved by many[/k] [k],[/k] [k]will be joining the team[/k] [k]next season.[/k]
[k]The staff[/k] [k],[/k] [k]whose[/k] [k]pay was late again[/k] [k],[/k] [k]decided[/k] [k]to leave the company.[/k]

Non-defining relative clauses are separated from the rest of the sentence with commas.
When speaking, we pause before and after a non-defining relative clause.
The family, whose house had been damaged in the storm, had to stay in a hotel.
Her second book [k], which[/k] was written in less than a month, won 6 prizes this year.
which
Select the correct word(s) to fill the gap.
A friend who lives in Spain [k]sent[/k] it to me.
, sent

who
was
